comment.author: 76204898@N00
comment._content:
A Miss Leila Harrison of Hartford, Conn., is mentioned in this Hartford Courant article which is sadly behind a paywall:

JUNIOR PROM ENDS TRINITY GAIETIES
BALL AND SEASON BOTH CALLED THE BEST YET Hall Prettily Decorated With Lights and Colors DANCING LASTS NEARLY UNTIL SUNRISE
The Hartford Courant (1887-1922) - Hartford, Conn.
Date:Feb 13, 1912

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: She is mentioned in the Washington (and some New York) papers of the period in the society columns, along with her mother Mrs. George F. E. Harrison, widow of a career military man. She made her debut in 1912, and married Geoffrey Keyes on 12/1/15, at West Point. She is pictured in the Utica New York Saturday Globe, described as a Washington beauty. fultonhistory.com/Process%20Small/Newspapers/Utica%20NY%2... Her husband retired as a Lt. General and held important commands during and after World War II. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Geoffrey_Keyes She died in 1956 at the age of 60.
